result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark D Allain

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:08 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF272 AND 15CM282. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person with Atty Kat Jackan.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF272: Ct. 1 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM282: Ct. 1 (OAR)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF272: Ct. 2 (Possess Illegally Obtained Prescriptions)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 3 (OAR)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; 30 days MCJ imposed and STAYED to be used at agent's discretion and with prior court approval; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; AODA; CC. 
COURT does NOT order DNA surcharge. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 3 days jail credit if revoked. 

Adj: 3:18 pm

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 8:41 am 
INCLUDES 15CM282 AND 15CF272. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft does NOT appear - Atty Kat Jackan appears on his behalf. 
COURT authorizes $2500 bench warrant and enters judgment of $2000. 
COURT forfeits new bond and sets BFH for 8/24/2015 at 1:30 pm in Br. 3. 
Adj: 8:43 am

Recalled: 9:12 am 
Deft now appears with Atty Kat Jackan. 
COURT vacates warrant and judgment. 
Atty Jackan makes statement and notes parties have agreement in this case. 
COURT vacates bond forfeiture and removes BFH date of 8/24/2015. 
COURT sets calendar call for 8/12/2015 at 1pm with Br. 3 JA. 
Adj: 9:15 am

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:09 am 
INCLUDES 15CM282 AND 15CF272
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft does NOT appear - Atty Kat Jackan appears on his behalf. 
Date and time was set for plea hearing. 
COURT authorizes $2500 bench warrant and orders bond forfeited. 
BFH set for 8/6/2015 at 8:30 am in Br. 3. 
Adj: 11:10 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 17, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 16, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 1:46 pm  
INCLUDES 15CF272 AND 15CM282. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person with Atty Kat Jackan. 

WAIVER OF PRELIM IN 15CF272. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information filed.  Reading Waived. 
Plea: Not Guilty. 
COURT sets calendar call on 5/13/2015 at 1pm with Br. 3 JA. 
Bond:  Continued. 
Adj: 1:47 pm
org warrant returned from Sheriff's dept
Review hearing on May 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 15, 2015 at 09:30 am.

INCLUDES 15CM282 & 15CF272   Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.   Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 on or before PTC. Absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without a valid prescription and only in the amount prescribed.
Defendant did not appear for initial appearance.
